arm_group.description: The group in which low supplemental oxygen concentration of 40% will be performed during minimally invasive esophagectomy.
The group in which high supplemental oxygen concentration (onventional) of 80% will be performed during minimally invasive esophagectomy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study hypothesized that a relative low oxygen concentration (40%) supplemental would be
      advantageous to protect the pulmonary function of patients, comparied with conventional high
      oxygen concentration (80%). Therefore we raise this prospective randomized controlled
      research.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Optimal Intraoperative Supplemental Oxygen Administration During Minimally Invasive Esophagectomy

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients underwent minimally invasive esophagectomy in Zhongshan Hospital of Fudan
      University will be enrolled and be randomizedly assigned to low oxygen concentration (40%)
      supplemental or high oxygen concentration(80%) supplemental group. Intra-operative and
      post-operative pressure of Oxygen in Arterial Blood will be examined, and the surgical
      outcome will be recorded in the two groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Clinical Staged T1-3N0M0 esophageal cancer patients or: patients who were restaged as
             T1-3N0M0 esophageal cancer after neo-adjuvant therapy.

          2. Patients underwent minimally invasive esophagectomy(Thoracolaparoscopic McKeown
             procedure).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients with previous thoracic surgery history.

          2. Patients with severe Co-morbidity.

          3. Pulmonary function is abnormal in the examination before surgery.

intervention.description: low supplemental oxygen concentration would be used during the surgery
high supplemental oxygen concentration would be used during the surgery

facility.name: Division of Thoracic Surgery & Anesthesiology, Zhongshan Hospital of Fudan University

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Different Intraoperative Supplemental Oxygen Administration on the Pulmonary Function Following Minimally Invasive Esophagectomy: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

primary_outcome.description: The change of oxygenation index is an important index to indicate the pulmonary function of patients.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at post-operative Day1

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Surgery; Vice Chief, Division of Thoracic Surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
